UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that represents a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Anticandida activity is retained in P-113, a 12-amino-acid fragment of histatin 5
Literature.Author: Rothstein DM, Spacciapoli P, Tran LT, Xu T, Roberts FD, Dalla Serra M, Buxton DK, Oppenheim FG, Friden P

Literature.Title: P-113D, an antimicrobial peptide active against Pseudomonas aeruginosa, retains activity in the presence of sputum from cystic fibrosis patients.
Literature.Author: Sajjan US, Tran LT, Sole N, Rovaldi C, Akiyama A, Friden PM, Forstner JF, Rothstein DM

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Candida albicans ATCC 44505(LD50=2.2±0.3µg/ml),Candida albicans ATCC 44505(LD90=4.8±0.13µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC=3.1µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa(MIC=1.6-6.3µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 6538(MIC=3.1µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus(MIC=6.3µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus Smith(MIC=6.3µg/ml),Haemophilus Influenzae(MIC=3.1-12.5µg/ml),Burkholderia cepacia(no activity data),Stenotrophomonas maltophilia(no activity data),Stenotrophomonas maltophilia 100BG(MIC=3.1-12.5µg/ml),Achromobacter xylosoxidans(no activity data)
